name: Interspace Battles
description:
Interspace Battles is a top-down 2D RTS inspired by the Homeworld series.

Take part in an epic tug of war between the blues and reds, command a fleet of hundreds of ships, and protect the supply lines that drive your economy.

Features
  • 10 distinct player ships to make up your fleet
  • 6 unique enemy ships opposing your advance
  • 7 constructible buildings to establish bases & expand territory
  • 4 powerful enemy structures guarding their spawn-points
  • 1 special game-ending ship...
  • 105 lines of dialogue spoken by your fighters
    • Dialogue is triggered by conditions such as being healed, taking damage, or spotting enemies.
  • Link to dialogue spreadsheet
  • There is no multiplayer at all; this is completely singleplayer

This game was made in 70 hours over the course of 18 days spread out across 3 months. This is my first RTS and the largest project I've ever done, and I am very happy with how it turned out.

It started off as an extremely basic fighter demo -> Fighter Demo Video <-

As it progressed, it evolved into what would inevitably become Interspace. Please leave any comments on how you think the game is. Thank you for checking out the page!

Credits
  • Main Menu Song - Looping Ascent by Joel Cummins
  • Ingame Music - Drifting at 432 Hz by Unicorn Heads
  • Builder Ship Sprite - Bill
  • All Other Sprites - Eapple
  • Programming - Eapple

Thanks to the dozen or so that helped test and provide feedback before release!
